instruction: Create an algorithm to solve the traveling salesman problem in Python with the provided inputs.
buggy_code:
import numpy as np
inputs = np.array([(1, 2, 10), (1, 3, 15), (2, 3, 10), (2, 4, 25), (3, 4, 20)])
dist_mat = np.zeros((inputs.shape[0], inputs.shape[0]))
for i in range(inputs.shape[0]):
    for j in range(inputs.shape[0]):
        if i != j:
            dist_mat[i, j] = inputs[i, 2] / inputs[j, 2]
start = inputs[0, 0]
end = inputs[-1, 1]

def tsp_finder(start, end, dist_mat):
    visited = np.zeros_like(dist_mat, dtype=bool)
    visited[start] = True
    curr = start
    min_dist = float('inf')
    opt_path = [curr]
    while curr != end:
        for node in range(dist_mat.shape[0]):
            if visited[node] == False:
                if dist_mat[curr, node] < min_dist:
                    min_dist = dist_mat[curr, node]
                    opt_path.append(node)
                    curr = node
        visited[curr] = True
    opt_path.append(end)
    return opt_path
optimal_path = tsp_finder(start, end, dist_mat)
print('Optimal Path:', optimal_path)
